* Use Calvados, a French apple brandy, or regular brandy if preferred. Red wine may also be used with excellent results.
1. Arrange the apple slices in a glass baking dish. Sprinkle with lemon juice and Applejack or your choice of brandies or wine. Dot with the butter. Add enough apple cider to fill the dish to a depth of 1 inch. 2. Bake in a preheated 375-degree oven for 20 minutes.
Recipe By : Jo Anne Merrill
From: Ladies Home Journal- August 1991
